definition: to put down the pen/to stop writing
to bear/to stand/to endure
to place/to put aside/to shelve
pen/pencil/writing brush/to write or compose/the strokes of Chinese characters/classifier for sums of money, deals/CL:支[zhi1],枝[zhi1]

sentences.english: I will end here and hope to hear from you very soon.
sentences.chinese: 我要就此搁笔了，盼望早日收到你的来信。

sentences.english: Mother wants me to help her in the kitchen. I'll say goodbye.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈要我下厨房帮忙，就此搁笔。

sentences.english: I want this to catch the morning mail, so I must shut up now.
sentences.chinese: 我要这信赶上早晨的邮班，所以只得搁笔了。

sentences.english: I have to stop here, since it is my working time, talk to you next time.
sentences.chinese: 由于正在工作中，就此搁笔，下次聊。

sentences.english: That's all for today, I'll talk to you more next time. Bye!
sentences.chinese: 今日就此搁笔，下次再跟大家闲聊，拜拜。

sentences.english: And by the time I got up, four hours had passed.
sentences.chinese: 当我搁笔时，已经过去了4个小时。

definition: to stop writing or painting/to leave off writing midway
to take up one's pen/to start to write
to put pen to paper/pen mark
to finish (a letter, a painting) at a stroke
to put pen to paper
to scribble rapidly
verse manuscript
to express emotion
variant of 箋|笺[jian1]
letter/note-paper
variant of 箋|笺[jian1]
my clumsy writing (humble expr.)/my humble pen
to write or draw with a brush/to put pen to paper/to write
to finish writing
to write
remuneration for literary or artistic work
to dip the pen into ink/to write
to write freely/to express oneself as one pleases
